pullRequest.title: Create Autorest Models, pom File and README for Azure Tables
pullRequest.bodyText:
closes #10963
The goal was to setup the structure for the tables SDK. This included creating the file structure and adding the pom and readme in addition to generate autorest models from the given swagger. Executed these tasks, and put them in the folder sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos-table/

nodes.bodyText:
The contents of this pom.xml should look similar to the template. It appears to be missing the distribution information and some other features.

https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/template/azure-sdk-template/pom.xml



The groupId, artifactId, and versionId should match our guidelines (https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_design.html#maven)


<groupId>com.azure</groupId>
<artifactId>azure-cosmos-table</artifactId> <!-- {x-version-update;com.azure:azure-cosmos-table;current} -->
<version>1.0.0-beta.1</version>

You may notice the metadata <!-- {x-version-update;com.azure:azure-cosmos-table;current} -->, this is what we use to keep track of our dependencies. You'll have to add a line in this file with your library.

https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/eng/versioning/version_client.txt#L21
In alphabetical order, add com.azure:azure-cosmos-table;1.0.0-beta.1;1.0.0-beta.1
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0
+ http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+  <groupId>org.example</groupId>

nodes.bodyText: One reason your pull request may be failing is because the README.md is expected to have certain headings. For now, you can copy the contents of https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/template/azure-sdk-template/README.md and fill in whatever information you can.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"

nodes.bodyText: There is some metadata that we use to track our dependencies you need to add to this version line. It is in the template pom.xml
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"

+

+  <artifactId>my-test-project</artifactId>
+  <version>1.0</version>
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+      <artifactId>azure-core</artifactId>
+      <version>1.5.0</version>

nodes.bodyText:
The folder should match the artifact name. In this case, it appears the artifact name should be azure-cosmos-table because it lives under the sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos-table folder.
If what you meant for this was it to be plural, you can move the contents to sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos-tables and rename the artifacts and generated namespace accordingly.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"

nodes.bodyText:
The MIT header license should have been generated on the top of each of these files.
If you add --license-header:MICROSOFT_MIT_SMALL when generating these classes, it'll add the license header to the top.
The package name should be com.azure.cosmos.table (table singular because your folder name is singular and I asserted that you meant for the package name to be singular, too).
https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/java_design.html#example-namespaces
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@
+package com.microsoft.azure.tables;

nodes.bodyText: nit: The version here should match the current version in the pom file which is 1.0.0-beta.1
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+# Azure Table client library for Java
+Azure Tables Azure Table storage is a service that stores structured NoSQL data in the cloud, providing a key/attribute store with a schemaless design.
+Tables storage gives developers flexibility and scalability with all the best parts of Azure cloud.
+
+Use the client library for Tables to:
+- manages tables
+- edit and access table contents 
+
+## Getting started
+
+### Prerequisites
+
+- Java Development Kit (JDK) with version 8 or above
+- [Azure Subscription][azure_subscription]
+
+
+### Include the Package
+
+[//]: # ({x-version-update-start;com.azure:cosmos:azure-cosmos-table;current})
+```xml
+<dependency>
+  <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+  <artifactId>azure-cosmos-table</artifactId>
+  <version>1.0.0-beta</version>

nodes.bodyText: This modules section shouldn't be here, this should be added to the modules list sdk/cosmos/pom.xml with the rest of the modules.

@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@

+  <artifactId>azure-cosmos-table</artifactId>
+  <packaging>pom</packaging>
+  <version>1.0.0</version><!-- Need not change for every release-->
+  <modules>
+    <module>azure-cosmos-table</module>

nodes.bodyText: Take a look at the pom file for azure-cosmos. I'm going to recommend that you copy lines 1-39, paste that over lines 1-14 in here, change the artifact and version to azure-cosmos-table version 1.0.0-beta.1 and that's a good start. You're also going to want to add this new library to the eng/jacoco-test-coverage project and those lines you're pasting also contain the properties to set the code coverage numbers to 0 or something low until you've got tests to generate coverage data.

nodes.bodyText: You're probably going to want to add a similar plugin configuration section for maven-enforcer-plugin which, at least, will have the com.azure:* bannedDependency include. Keep in mind that anything that's not com.azure:* will need to get architect approval if it's not already one of the approved includes.

nodes.bodyText: Suggestion: You should probably change this CosmosSkip to CosmosTableSkip, the CosmosSkip is something specific for the Cosmos team and I wouldn't want the one in here to get mixed up with the other item.

nodes.bodyText: The only plugin entry that should be in here is the maven-enforcer-plugin. The revapi and surfire entries shouldn't be in here.

nodes.bodyText: This change shouldn't be in here, you'd fixed this as part of another PR. You should probably rebase with master.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -76,7 +76,7 @@ Use the [Azure CLI][azure_cli] snippet below to create/get client secret credent
     }
     ```
 
-* Use the returned credentials above to set  **AZURE_CLIENT_ID**(appId), **AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET**(password) and **AZURE_TENANT_ID**(tenant) [environment variables](#environment-variables).
+* Use the returned credentials above to set  **AZURE\_CLIENT\_ID**(appId), **AZURE\_CLIENT\_SECRET**(password) and **AZURE\_TENANT\_ID**(tenant) [environment variables](#environment-variables).

nodes.bodyText: For track 2 libraries, the package name should start with com.azure.table instead of com.microsoft.azure.table
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@
+package com.microsoft.azure.table;

nodes.bodyText: Since this is autogenerated, the builder, client and method group clients should all be in implementation package. com.azure.table.implementation.

All these generated files are missing copyright text. Autorest has an option to generate copyright text.
--license-header=MICROSOFT_MIT_SMALL

commit.message: changing README and pom file to be based on template
fixing with naming, version and things connie suggested
Fixed pom and some version issues which were in Jim's comments
fix swagger location and pom mistake
